content: waste yarn add a tag and label it 1 knit 12 stitches put those stitches on a safety pin or waste yarn add a tag and label it 2 knit 1 stitch and use it to start the bind off the next 9 stitches you will end with 1 stitch on the right needle here s what it will look like at this halfway point now finish the set up for handles knit 11 stitches put the last 12 stitches on a safety pin or waste yarn add a tag and label it 3 knit 12 stitches put those stitches on a safety pin or waste yarn add a tag and label it 4 knit 1 stitch and bind off the remaining 9 stitches you should have 1 stitch left on your needle you will need to use 2 dpns for making the handles put your one stitch on the right dpn move the 11 stitches labeled 1 onto your left dpn save this pin and label for later row 1 ssk knit to the last 3 stitches k2tog k1 turn row 2 purl turn row 3 k1 ssk knit to the last 3 stitches k2tog k1 turn row 4 purl turn repeat row 3 one more time but do not turn you should have 6 stitches left you will use those stitches to knit an i-cord push those stitches to the right of your needle and knit you can snug up the yarn before and after the second stitch repeat this step until you have 14 of i-cord don t worry if it s separated a bit at the back when finished you can roll it between your palms like you re making a clay snake and it will even up and round off - like magic turn after your last row of i-cord row 1 purl and turn row 2 k1 m1r k to last stitch m1l k1 turn repeat the last 2 row twice you should have 12 stitches on your needle put these stitches back on the stitch holder labeled 1 leave about 12 of working yarn and cut yarn second handle put the 12 stitches on stitch holder 3 onto a dpn with the right side of your knitting facing you join yarn row 1 k1 ssk knit to the last 3 stitches k2tog k1 turn row 2 purl turn repeat these two row once then repeat row 1 one more time do not turn after this last row you should have 6 stitches left push those stitches to the right of your needle and knit oh no not more i-cord yes but only 3 this time turn after your last row of i-cord row 1 purl and turn row 2 k1 m1r k to last stitch m1l k1 turn repeat the last 2 row twice you should have 12 stitches on your needle leave the stitches on the needle leave about 12 of working yarn and cut the yarn joining handles to bag put
